src.title: A Dictionary of american idioms, fifth edition
src.author: Adam Makkai, Ph.D.

src.title: Word Reference : Dictionnaire de langue en ligne

entry.trad: Il faudra me marcher sur le corps!

head.expr: Dig one's heels in or dig one's toes in
Go toe to toe with somebody
Step one one's toes or tread on one's toes

entry.alt: Step on [sb]'s toes, tread on [sb]'s toes
Have your feet on the ground
Get your foot in the door
entry.trad: Mettre le pied [quelque part], avoir un pied [quelque part]
Avoir le pied dans la place

head.expr: Land on one's feet also land on both feet
Let grass grow under one's feet

entry.alt: Let the grass grow under your feet
Have one foot in the grave
entry.trad: Avoir un pied dans la tombe

entry.alt: Play footsie with [sb], play footsies with [sb]

head.expr: Put one's foot in it or put one's foot in one's mouth

entry.alt: Put your foot in your mouth
entry.trad: Mettre les pieds dans le plat

head.expr: Shake the dust from one's feet

entry.alt: Shake the dust from your feet

head.expr: Stand on one's own feet or stand on one's own two feet

entry.alt: Stand on your own two feet

head.expr: Take a load off one's feet
Head over heels also heels over head

entry.trad: Tomber raide dingue (amoureux), tomber raide dingue (amoureuse)
Tomber fou amoureux, tomber folle amoureuse
Tomber raide dingue (amoureux) de [qqn], tomber raide dingue (amoureuse) de [qqn]
Tomber fou amoureux de [qqn], tomber folle amoureuse de [qqn]

entry.alt: Fall head over heels in love with [sb]
entry.trad: Tomber raide dingue (amoureux) de [qqn], tomber raide dingue (amoureuse) de [qqn]
Tomber fou amoureux de [qqn], tomber folle amoureuse de [qqn]

head.expr: Set back one one's heels or knock back on one's heels
Take to one's heels also show a clean pair of heels

entry.alt: Show [sb] a clean pair of heels, show a clean pair of heels to [sb]

entry.trad: Réaction instinctive, réaction spontanée, réaction irréfléchie

head.expr: Cost an arm and a leg

entry.alt: Cost an arm and a leg
entry.trad: Coûter les yeux de la tête

head.expr: Get a leg up on one
Not a leg to stand on

entry.alt: Not have a leg to stand on
entry.trad: Reposer sur rien, reposer sur du vent
Démarrer au quart de tour, partir au quart de tour

head.expr: A pain in the ass or a pain in the butt or a pain in the rear

entry.alt: Pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)

head.expr: Bust one's ass or bust one's balls or bust one's chop
Flat on one's ass or flat on one's back
Get one's ass in gear or get one's rear in gear
Have one's ass in a sling
Out on one's ass or out on one's ear

entry.trad: Dire ce qu'on a sur le cœur

head.expr: Back to the wall or back against the wall

entry.alt: Have your back to the wall

head.expr: Break the back of somebody or something
Weight of the world on one's shoulders or world on one's shoulders or world on one's back
Stick out like a sore thumb

entry.trad: Pouce en bas, pouce vers le bas

head.expr: Under one's thumb or under the thumb

entry.alt: Get your fingers burned (US), get your fingers burnt (UK), burn your fingers
Have a finger in the pie

head.expr: lift a finger or lift a hand also raise a hand

entry.alt: Lift a finger, lift a hand

head.expr: Put one's finger on also lay one's finger on
Twist one around one's little finger also turn one around one's little finger or wrap one around one's little finger
Grease one's palm or grease the palm

entry.alt: Grease [sb]'s palm, grease the palm of [sb], grease [sb]'s hand, grease the hand of [sb]

head.expr: At hand also at close hand or near at hand
Bite the hand that feeds one
Hand in glove or hand and glove

entry.alt: Hand in glove also US: hand and glove
Hand in glove with [sb/sth], also US: hand and glove with [sb/sth]

head.expr: Have in the palm of one's hand

entry.alt: Have [sb] in the palm of your hand

entry.trad: Ne pas avoir une minute à soi
Agir main dans la main [avec qqn]

entry.alt: Lay your hands on [sth], lay hands on [sth]

head.expr: Lend a hand or give a hand also bear a hand

entry.alt: Live from hand to mouth, live hand to mouth
entry.trad: Avoir du mal à joindre les deux bouts
Tirer le diable par la queue

entry.alt: On the one hand ... on the other hand, on the one hand ... on the other, on one hand ... on the other hand, on one hand ... on the other

head.expr: Put one's hand to or set one's hand to or turn one's hand to
Put one's hand to the plow or set one's hand to the plow

entry.alt: Vote by a show of hands

entry.trad: Gagner les doigts dans le nez

head.expr: Elbow one's way into or out of

entry.alt: Elbow your way in, elbow in
entry.trad: Jouer des coudes pour entrer quelque part

entry.alt: Rub shoulders with [sb], rub elbows with [sb]
Have a chip on your shoulder
entry.trad: En vouloir à tout le monde

entry.alt: Have a good head on your shoulders
entry.trad: Avoir la tête sur les épaules

entry.alt: Be head and shoulders above [sb/sth], stand head and shoulders above [sb/sth]

head.expr: Put one's shoulder to the wheel
Shoulder the burden or shoulder the task
Shoulder to cry on or to lean on

entry.trad: Se casser le cul, se crever le cul

head.expr: Catch it in the neck or get it in the neck
Put a noose around one's neck
Save one's neck or save one's skin
Stick one's neck out or stick one's chin out

entry.trad: To be at each other's throats: s'étriper

entry.alt: Have a lump in your throat
entry.trad: Avoir une boule dans la gorge

head.expr: Shove down one's throat or ram down one's throat

entry.trad: Faire rentrer [qch] dans la crâne de [qqn]

head.expr: Thrust down one's throat or push down one's throat
At the tip of one's tongue or on the tip of one's tongue

entry.alt: Be on the tip of your tongue
entry.trad: Avoir [qch] sur le bout de la langue
Tu as perdu ta langue ?, Tu as avalé ta langue ?

entry.alt: Hold your tongue, bite your tongue

head.expr: Keep a civil tongue in one's head
Slip of the tongue also slip of the lip
By the skin of one's teeth

entry.alt: By the skin of your teeth

head.expr: Fly in the face of or fly in the teeth of
Get one's teeth into or sink one's teeth into
Kick in the pants or kick in the teeth

entry.trad: Mentir comme un arracheur de dents

head.expr: No skin off my nose or no skin off my teeth
Throw something in someone's face or throw something in one's teeth
Button one's lip also zip one's lip

entry.alt: Button your mouth, button your lip

head.expr: lips are sealed SEE MUM IS THE WORD
Read my lips or mark my words
Born with a silver spoon in one's mouth

entry.alt: Born with a silver spoon in your mouth
entry.trad: Né avec une cuillière d'argent dans la bouche

entry.alt: Foam at the mouth, froth at the mouth

head.expr: Jaw drop or jaw drop a mile

entry.trad: Se réjouir d'avance (de [qch]), se réjour à l'avance (de [qch])
Mettre l'eau à la bouche à [qqn]

head.expr: Put one's money where one's mouth is

entry.alt: Put your money where your mouth is
entry.trad: Joindre le geste et la parole

head.expr: Shoot off one's mouth or shoot off one's face
Cut off one's nose to spite one's face

entry.alt: Cut off your nose to spite your face
entry.trad: Scier la branche sur laquelle on est assis
Se tirer une balle dans le pied
Être pris à son propre piège

head.expr: Keep one's nose to the grindstone or have one's nose to the grindstone or hold one's nose to the grindstone

entry.alt: Keep your nose to the grindstone

entry.trad: Mener [qqn] par le bout du nez
Regarder de haut, prendre de haut, traiter de haut

head.expr: Nose in the air or have one's nose in the air

entry.alt: On the nose, right on the nose

head.expr: Put one's nose out of joint
See beyond one's nose or see beyond the end of one's nose

entry.alt: It's not skin off my back, it's no skin off my nose
entry.trad: Ça ne me fait ni chaud ni froid

entry.alt: Turn up your nose at [sth], turn your nose up at [sth]

head.expr: Under one's nose or under the nose of
Come to the ears of someone

entry.alt: Have your ear to the ground, keep your ear to the ground

head.expr: Give an ear to or lend an ear to

entry.alt: Lend an ear to [sb], lend [sb] an ear

head.expr: Go in one ear and out the other

entry.alt: Go in one ear and out the other
entry.trad: Entrer par une oreille et sortir par l'autre

entry.alt: Pin back your ears, pin your ears back

head.expr: Bat an eye or bat an eyelash

entry.alt: Not bat an eyelash (US), not bat an eyelid (UK)
entry.trad: Ne pas sourciller, ne pas ciller

entry.alt: Bright eyed and bushy tailed, bright-eyed and bushy-tailed

head.expr: Close one's eyes or shut one's eyes

entry.trad: Faire semblant de ne pas voir

head.expr: Eyes are bigger than one's stomach
Eyes in the back of one's head
Get an eyeful or take an eyeful

entry.alt: See with half an eye, see with half an eye that

head.expr: Have an eye on or have one's eye on

entry.alt: Only have eyes for [sb], have eyes only for [sb]

head.expr: Keep an eye on or keep one's eye on or have one's eye on
Keep one's eyes peeled or keep one's eyes skimmed
Lay eyes on or set eyes on
Look in the eye or look in the face

entry.alt: There is more to [sth] than meets the eye
entry.trad: Il doit y avoir une autre explication

entry.alt: Not bat an eyelash (US), not bat an eyelid (UK)
entry.trad: Ne pas sourciller, ne pas ciller

head.expr: Out of the corner of one's eye

entry.alt: Out of the corner of your eye

head.expr: Pull the wool over one's eyes

entry.alt: Turn a blind eye on [sth], turn a blind eye to [sth]

head.expr: By the sweat of one's brow

entry.alt: Raise eyebrows, raise a few eyebrows

head.expr: Have a long face or have on a long face
Till one is blue in the face

entry.alt: Until you are blue in the face
Get in [sb]'s hair, be in [sb]'s hair

head.expr: Let one's hair down or let down one's hair
Pull one's hair out over or tear one's hair out over
Bang one's head against a brick wall
Bury one's head in the sand

entry.alt: Bury your head in the sand

entry.trad: Garder la tête hors de l'eau

head.expr: Hide one's head in the sand or bury one's head in the sand or have one's head in the sand

entry.alt: Bury your head in the sand

head.expr: Keep one's cool or keep one's head
Keep one's head also keep one's wits about one

entry.alt: Keep your wits about you, have your wits about you

entry.trad: Garder la tête hors de l'eau

head.expr: like a hole in the head
Make one's head spin or swim
Off the top of one's head

entry.alt: Off the top of your head

head.expr: Scream one's head off or yell one's head off
Use one's head or use one's bean or use one's noodle or use one's noggin

entry.trad: Donner la chair de poule à [qqn]
Flier la chair de poule à [qqn]

head.expr: Cross one's heart or cross one's heart and hope to die

entry.alt: Cross my heart, cross my heart and hope to die

head.expr: Find it in one's own heart
From the bottom of one's heart or with all one's heart

entry.alt: My heart bleeds for you., My heart bleeds, How my heart bleeds for you
entry.trad: Arrête, tu vas me faire pleurer !
Avoir le cœur sur la main

head.expr: Heart in one's mouth or heart in one's boots

entry.alt: Set your heart on [sth], have your heart set on [sth]

head.expr: Take to heart also lay to heart

entry.trad: Tant qu'il vous plaît, tant qu'il te plaît, tant qu'il te plaira, tant qu'il vous plaira

head.expr: Wear one's heart on one's sleeve also pin one's heart on one's sleeve

entry.alt: Wear your heart on your sleeve
entry.trad: Lire en [qqn] comme dans un livre ouvert

head.expr: At the top of one's voice or at the top of one's lungs

entry.alt: At the top of your lungs

head.expr: Blood runs cold or blood freezes or blood turns to ice

entry.alt: Make [sb]'s blood run cold, make your blood run cold

head.expr: Bone to pick or crow to pick

entry.alt: Have a bone to pick with [sb]
entry.trad: Avoir une maille à partir avec
Avoir un compte à régler avec

head.expr: Feel in one's bones or know in one's bones

entry.alt: Rack your brains, rack your brain, wrack your brains, wrack your brain

head.expr: Wrap one's brain or wrap one's mind around something
